duties_responsibilities.duty: Read, understand, and follow SOPs, complying with cGMP.
Write and/or revise Quality documentation using electronic document management systems.
Maintain routine presence in the QC and analytical laboratories.
Support the disposition of intermediates and finished products through timely evaluation of Certificate of Analysis, laboratory results, and other cGMP documents.
Review documents such as SOPs, deviations, change control requests, corrective and preventive action plans, etc., submitted to QA for approval.
Create and manage deviations, change controls, and CAPA records pertaining to functional areas in the electronic quality management system.
Ability to work 'off-hours' as needed to support release of product to meet patient dosing needs.

education_certification.credential: B.S. degree in Science, Engineering, or related technical field
